page.title: 06Arrow Mill
page.content: There has been a mill on the Arrow since the first Domesday in 1066. Then it was worth 6s.8p. The present Mill stopped working in 1962 when the buildings were bought and changed into a restaurant.All the workings were removed. Today the restaurant is very prosperous,standing in its own grounds and approached from the A435 down a long drive.The workings from another mill function here now and you can sit and eat looking over the mill pond watching the wheel go round. The present tenants Mr and Mrs Woodhams are changing the upstairs into accomodation and by this summer there will be fifteen bedrooms. A small farmyard of animals is centred around the old stables which once housed the horses and carts.The Arrow Mill is a very popular eating place.
